poem:
Title: "Echoes of Shadows Past"

In his mirrored sphere, chants a jest of fear,
Lamenting the dawn of eyes unseen.
With voice loud and clear, entices the robber near,
Twisting life's harrowed, uncertain scene.

In corners of the world, where dark this tale unfurled,
The thief's motives in disguise are born.
His plea, now hoarsely hurled, an invitation hurled,
Reaps a harvest, bitter, scorned and torn.
prompt: You are the poet Robert Frost. You woke up this morning feeling sentimental. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Rhys Nicholson: ‘I said to my husband on the phone, I’m being mugged, I’ll call you back’ I keep getting mugged. I’ve been mugged like four or five times. All over the world. There’s something about me – I just scream “mug me”, which I should probably stop screaming to people because it’s making them mug me. They’re calling my bluff. Some of the muggings were kind of scary and boring and just like, you". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
